p: It is important to note that the CPC analysis of both EOs of J. oxisedrus subsp. deltoides fruits and P. pinea needles are presented here for the first time. The analysis of CPC fractions presents a successful fractionation of both EOs in a short time ( Figure S3: supplementary material) leading to the recovery of the major compounds in pure form or in enriched fractions. Taking into account that countercurrent chromatography offers the advantage of ideal scaling-up from analytical to preparative and pilot processes [ 22] we conclude that this technique can be a good tool for the treatment of these demanding mixtures and the efficient recovery of high-value volatile compounds.
